model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
You job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Parent, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes" or "No"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker B: Rescuing animals is a great thing to do. But I wonder if the cats and your parrot would get along!

MEMORY:
1. Speaker A has a parrot as a pet and is considering adopting a rescue kitten.
2. Speaker A has a parrot named Tasha and is interested in adopting a rescue kitten.
3. Speaker A is interested in training tips for the kittens and is open to adopting one despite having a parrot.
4. Speaker B recently filled out adoption paperwork for rescue kittens and is considering giving them Mandarin names based on their personalities.
5. Speaker A suggested the name Zhao for one of the kittens.
6. Speaker B has an older mellow cat and is concerned about training the new energetic kittens.
current_dialogue: Speaker B: Rescuing animals is a great thing to do. But I wonder if the cats and your parrot would get along!

raw_prediction: I've been researching how to introduce them properly. I think with the right training and supervision, they can coexist peacefully. It'll just take some time and patience to make sure everyone is comfortable around each other.
